newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt money market finds no borrowers.
newsitem.headline: Egypt money market finds no borrowers.

text.p: Borrowers did not show up in the Egyptian private interbank market on Wednesday due to large liquidity left over from the treasury bond offer, bankers said.

"All major banks dealing in the Egyptian pound are long," one banker said. "The banks were keeping large amounts for the T-bond subscription, but they got back 60 percent of their applications," he added.
The central bank offered seven-year bonds worth four billion pounds and received applications for bonds worth 10.119 billion. The bonds carry a fixed interest rate of 11 percent.
"I was ready to lend one-week for nine or even eight percent, but there was no borrower," the banker said.
Tuesday's overnight and one-week rates were 10 1/4.
The banker said he only did one 50-day transaction at 10 1/8 percent.
"The market is worried now that the treasury will reduce the volume of the T-Bills," he added. "They might even not hold six-month T-Bills next week."
The treasury has not issued new T-bills since September 17.
